title: Executive Order 8654-Revoking the Designation of Molson, Washington, as a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by section 1 of the act of August 1, 1914, 38 Stat. 609, 623 (U.S.C., title 19, sec. 2), it is ordered that the designation of Molson, Washington, as a customs port of entry in Customs Collection District No. 30 (Washington), be, and it is hereby, revoked.
This order shall become effective at the close of business January 31, 1941.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8654-Revoking the Designation of Molson, Washington, as a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/368216
